message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this exceptional product. It's a unique opportunity to own a truly exceptional item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12000. I believe you'll find it's worth every penny.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. Can you meet me at that price?

I understand you're interested in the product, and I appreciate your willingness to make an offer. However, I'm not quite ready to meet you at $9000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $10500. This is a fair price considering the product's value and uniqueness.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to compromise and offer $10000. Can you consider that?

I'm glad we're getting closer to a deal, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, I still believe the product's value warrants a higher price. I'm willing to meet you at $10000, but I'm not willing to go any lower. I'll throw in an additional incentive - I'll include a premium service package worth $500. So, I'm counteroffering at $10500. This is my final offer, but I'm open to negotiations.

I appreciate the additional incentive, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $10000, but I need to be honest, I'm getting a bit concerned about the price. Can you reconsider and meet me at $10000, without the premium service package?
